repnme.cdata!:
Algeria - Housing Completion and Sector
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall assessment of the Housing
            Completion and Sector Development Project is rated
            satisfactory. Despite a difficult environment, physical
            goals were largely met. Policy changes took place during
            implementation, which contributed to a successful
            development, with efficiency gains. Key lessons suggest that
            separating housing subsidies from housing finance is a key
            requirement in reforming housing finance. This would not
            only allow for improvements in the housing finance sector,
            from the government's perspective, but would provide
            potentiality for the housing market integration to succeed
            in financial markets. However, this separation carries risks
            and may become costly. Within this framework, Treasury bonds
            were issued to replace an accumulated debt, and the public
            housing program was then funded through the Budget Law. The
            risk of the adjustment process was slowed-down by delaying
            public divestiture from the housing sector. In turn,
            political and social constraints may delay policy decisions,
            risking the speed of reforms, particularly when facing
            claims from a large population, including the middle class.
            Thus, properly targeted housing subsidies may accelerate
            reforms, while preserving impoverished populations. However,
            the success of the project shows that these measures
            triggered, largely, the housing reform, where the public
            housing program finance transformed itself into a
            competitive financial institution.

docna.cdata!:
Algeria - Housing Completion and Sector
            Development Project

display_title.display_title:
Algeria - Housing Completion and
            Sector Development Project

5079373.trustfund: TF020090-BELGIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND,TF020250-FRENCH CONSULTANTS TRUST FUND
5079373.majtheme: Financial and private sector development,Environment and natural resource management,Social protection and risk management

repnme.cdata!:
Algeria - Housing Completion and Sector
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project includes the completion of a
            social housing program for sale, an import program of
            critical building materials for the private sector, and a
            technical assistance program.  The Social Housing Program
            for Sale (SHPS) aims at accelerating the completion of about
            51,000 social units for sale, mostly under Entreprises de
            Promotion et de Logement Familial's (EPLF) management,
            through: supply of strategic construction materials (cement,
            wood and steel rods), finishing products, and small
            equipment and spare parts.  The private housing program,
            targeted primarily to self-help builders, aims at assisting
            the private sector in completing its unfinished housing
            stock.  It will supply the private sector with strategic
            construction materials.  The technical assistance component
            aims at assisting the Government in implementing key housing
            policy objectives in the following three critical areas:
            improving the housing supply incentives; reforming housing
            finance; and reforming and targeting housing subsidies.  In
            addition, the technical assistance program will provide
            specific support to the Ministry of Housing to mitigate the
            negative environmental impact of the housing construction sector.

Algeria - Housing Completion and Sector
            Development Project
